title: Energy Calculation Function Block
description:
ENERGY in diferent, in practice common units of
energy. Normally, only the input to be converted is occupied and the reï¿¾maining inputs remain free. However, if several inputs loaded with values,
the values of all inputs are converted accordingly and then summed.
1 J = 1 Ws (Watt * Seconds) = 1 Nm (Newton * meters)
1 C = 4,1868 J = 1,163 * 10 -3 Wh (watt * hours) 
1 Wh = 3,6 * 103 J = 860 C
name: ENERGY

input.name: C
input.description: Capacity in a specific energy unit.

output.name: YJ
output.description: Calculated energy in Joules after conversion.

output.name: YC
output.description: Energy in a calculated unit based on YJ.

output.name: YWh
output.description: Converted energy from YJ to watt-hours.
